result.execSummary:
The defendant Hamilton A Marquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hamilton A Marquez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hamilton A Marquez was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Hamilton A Marquez was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay applicable surcharge.
AS TO EACH COUNT:  pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be entered.
Maintain full time work, school or a combination of both.

No contact with Cut Throat mob or any known gang member.
No weapons.
Court grants expunction if defendant successfully completes probation, has no new arrests rising to the level of probable cause and all fines are paid in full.

AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended tretment.  Absolute sobriety.
*Conditions apply to both counts/case.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: count one. Straight time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hamilton A Marquez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, straight time.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.


AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1, straight time.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Absolute Sobriety
-AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-Maintain full time work, school, or a combination of both
-No contact with Cut throat mob or any known gang member
-No weapons
-Provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid during the period of probation, or a civil judgment will be entered. 

*Court grants expunction if defendant successfully completes probation, has no new arrests rising to the level of probable cause, and all fines are paid in full. 

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Hamilton A Marquez in court with attorney Richard Joseph Smith.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 3 DISMISSED.

Defendant Hamilton A Marquez in court with attorney Richard Joseph Smith.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's current residece is at the Milwaukee Rescue MIssion.  Jury trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hamilton A Marquez in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. For reasons stated on the off the record form, case adjourned for status conference in Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hamilton A Marquez in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant needs additional time to obtain private counsel. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or any dangerous weapons or firearms.   
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Hamilton A Marquez in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/9/15 @ 1:30pm
